title: First BA business flight...hopefully last!!
text: We had bus. class purchased with cruise fare. The bad: Checking bags and getting boarding passes they acted like it was such a "bother". We asked where the gate was and they said it would be "up" 15 minutes before boarding. kinda hard when we were in a strange airport. It is a zoo, so difficult to find gates. The aircraft had no real bus. class. They just give u 3 seats, no more room, very crowded. Why pay for bus.class?? Seats were just like coach class. No food, they were out of everything except what we were alergetic to. (fish)

title: wonderful food and atmosphere
text:
Food is exceptional and service. We had all our meals here during our stay.
View is perfect! We will defininely return

title: Luxury at its finest
text:
This hotel deserves all of it's 5 star ratings! Service from staff is wonderful. Our luggage was lost upon arrival and they did the impossible to help us find. I give them all the credit for finding our luggage.
The restaurant is very good. We had breakfast and dinner there. The view is fabulous.
place: King George, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Athens

title: Great flight on 787
text:
WOW What a great experience! My husband and I flew this great plane from Chicago to Athens. The seating arrangement in B.Class is perfect. Great food and drink. Pushed one button and bed was made. Slept wonderful after a movie. 2 or 3 flight attendants were there all the time. Love to make this flight every day.
Bummer: Flew British A return---terrible., Don't ever pay for B.Class on B.A.

title: beautiful ancient ruins
text:
We were there the last of Sept. Seemed crowded, but we heard it was really bad during the summer months. It was a long climb, but worth it. We took our time and it made it easier.
It is very sad that some people have to stop and take pictures of EVERYTHING. I ran right over a lady who stopped in front of me!!

title: Wonderful Lunch on Patio
text:
We stopped here because we were at the Chamber office near this restaurant. Hyatt lets all visitors use there nice rest rooms! We saw a table on the patio and it was lovely weather.
Food was excellent! Wait staff (Linda) was very good. We had a mix-up on our order and it was resolved quickly.
Whenever in Louisville we plan to return. The hotel looked nice too!
We had burbon breaded chicken fingers. Great!!

title: Great tour
text:
We were looking for a city tour and didn't seem to find one on TA. We went to the Chamber location downtown and they recommended this tour. WOW, we were so glad we discovered them. The young men guides are very good. They know the city well and give a very interesting short tour..
The trolleys are clean and well kept.
We recommend to anyone who wants to see the city.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
The Brown is a beautiful hotel. I think it is living on its past glory. Rooms are average in size, bath is nice. Absolutely NO water pressure in shower. All was clean and great towels. The staff is wonderful, very efficient and nice.
The location is good. Easy to walk to city center.
We spent 3-nites here before a River Cruise.

title: We didn't plan to go here, but glad we did...
text:
We had planned to go to Bricktown, since we had never been there. The hotel told us there was a ball game and very crowded, with parking a premium.
Charleston's was right by our hotel, so we chose this restaurant. Great choice!!
Very crowded, but didn't seem to be a problem for them. Menu is great and lots of choices. Staff is excellent and fast. We will definitely go back next time in OK city.

title: Wonderful restaurant
text:
We had been here several years ago and couldn't wait to return.
It has great seafood and the service is exceptional. Dining on the patio is really nice with the water falls.
We made reservations, afraid we wouldn't get to sit on patio. All worked great. If ever in Spokane, you must go here.

title: Always Good
text:
You can always expect a great meal at this restaurant!
They have a variety of meals to make anyone happy. Hamburgers to great steaks.
Go early Monday to Friday and get their special. Yum.

title: Great Pizza and Salad
text:
What great pizza! I am really "picky" about my pizza and this was the best!!
The salad bar had everything you could ever think you needed on a salad. Really fresh and good.
Pizza was all you can eat and many varieties. They even had pizza dessert. Apple and cherry.
Wish we lived closer so we could return. Don't go to Gaylord without going here.

title: NO Gold Crown!
text:
This property is truly beautiful...after you get past the check-in.
We exchanged through RCI and had never seen Northern Michigan.
Check-in was not a good experience. All they gave us were negatives. We were early for check-in. All these were NO: your are early, no amenities, no ideas of where to wait, etc., no packet of things to do, when I asked they pointed to rack with brochures.
The condo was really nice, clean and large. The view from the patio was really beautiful. It could use some cleaning up, but after all it is a forest! The stream was nice.
Northern Michigan is beautiful. Lots of things to do and see.
Don't expect much at check-in, check-out and you won't be disappointed.

title: Fun place, good beer and food
text:
Great waitress and food. In a week, we went 3-4 times.
Salads are super! All beer is good.
Try to go early, although big place, it gets really crowded.
Sit outside, nice, clean and fun.

title: OK, If you have no allergies to animals!!
text:
When booking I specifically asked for a pet free room. When we arrived they said that had NO pet free room. Very difficult when you have allergies. Dogs running everywhere, no specific area in or out where they could go.
Room was clean, nice beds, etc. Breakfast was great.
We will not return
place: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Gainesville

title: Thanksgiving Eve
text:
Went here for a light meal or snack. Was very nice, and had a great bar menu and drink specials. We didn't realize it was happy hour. Definitely return.
Easy to find on the Plaza

title: Great Resort off the main Highway
text:
A great location in Marathon. We exchanged here from RCI. Our condo faced a small green area and a fence. No water or pool view. We were lucky, no parking lot view!
The condo's are very large (one bedroom), nice kitchen and extra large bath. Everything looked new. You can have fresh towels and trash anytime you call. Nice.
Lots of good parking. There is a resort fee. $76.00

title: Could be better
text: We've stayed in several S'hill Suites. They are very nice because of the rooms are nicely divided. I was disappointed in the towels and linens. The towels are almost paper thin. Breakfast was good. I thought the lady doing all the replacing food, cleaning etc, could have used some help. It was the weekend and VERY crowded. She did a great job!
place: SpringHill Suites Dallas DFW Airport North/Grapevine

title: Great small hotel in the center of downtown
text:
We really enjoyed our week stay at the Donatello. Staff is great and seems to go out of their way to make everything perfect.
We really enjoyed the club room. The concierge is very helpful and knows "everything" to make your vacation enjoyable. We used several of their suggestions.

title: Enjoyed this trip. It was very organized and easy
text: Booked this through Viator. FYI, get tickets early, they sell out early and all boats are full.. I enjoyed seeing the island, knowing that families of the guards and warden once lived there was interesting. Glad to know there was a tram that took you up to the cell block, don't think with a bad knee we could have made the up hill walk.

title: Something for everyone
text: There is sooo much here. All ages can find something. Food, shopping, farmer's market, any kind of restaurant. Free shows, and even sea lions! All of your family will enjoy.

title: Really interesting and easy to see everything in an afternoon
text: We took our two grandchildren, ages 5 and 6. I was afraid they were too young to enjoy. They really had a great time and there were exhibits for all ages. We went on a sunday and very, very crowded. Next time I would choose a different day.

title: Love American customer service
text:
Thanks to their Advantage program, we have flown many miles with AA.
Never a piece of luggage lost or not arrived on time. We changed planes several times in Europe and luggage was always there.
Love all the perks of Premium.

title: Don't waste your time!!
text:
Dirty, ugly, not a place you want to go.
Lots of times, terrible words are written on the cars. Yuk, who would want to see that?
Why it is called an "attraction" I will never know.

title: Great for carry-out
text: No atmosphere. Good barbeque. Very small place. Sometimes hard to find a seat. They have had several articles in local magazines about how good food is.

title: Nice location, quiet resort
text:
This is truly a beautiful area in CO. This was an RCI exchange. It is rated as a Gold Crown.
I can't say enough about the staff. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and do everything to make sure your visit is pleasant. We've been to lots of resorts (35 yrs. of exchanging) and this is one of the best for the staff. The condo is really large. We had a one bedroom and it definitely would be large enough for more children or adults. It had 2 full bathrooms! Washer and dryer. Full kitchen.
Beautiful living area with fireplace.
Only negative: The "clubhouse" is not the best. The first thing you see when leaving the parking lot is the large dumpster near the front door. Yuk! We were about an hour early for check-in and they said we could wait outside on the patio because inside was very hot from the pool. The patio was very dirty and full of bird droppings. Had to clean chairs before we could sit down. We were hoping that our experience with the condo was better than the first opinion.
Later in the week, they had a very nice reception for all quests.
I left an item and they immediately returned. Nice.
We would definitely return

title: Excellent dining
text: We sat on the patio. Was lovely! Waitress was great and food was super. Arrived for "happy hour" and waitress was very nice to tell us. Definitely return.

title: Great small hotel
text:
In booking this hotel, I wondered if we had made the correct choice, well, we did!
Everything was perfect. Staff goes out of their way to make you feel special. Very clean and spotless. The cleaning lady even came to our room one day to make sure we didn't need something! How many hotels do that?
Spent 2 nights here before a cruise. Location is very good; lots of nice restaurants close. Definitely return.
Breakfast was the best we've ever had in a hotel!

title: Beautiful property
text:
The grounds and building is fabulous! Staff is very nice and helped us get a later check-out since we arrived at 5:00 AM. Our flight was delayed about 6 hours at LAX. We called from LA and they said we could check out at 12:00 noon, after we arrived, they said it was 11:00 AM. It was all OK.
Our room was VERY small, but accommodating. Only complaint was the bath room was "postage stamp" size! Stayed in a lot of hotels in US and Europe and I think this was the smallest! The sink had about 3" of room for your "stuff" and no shelves. The beautiful property made up for the small rooms.

title: Great food, wonderful view
text:
Went here for our 49th anniversary. View was exceptional!. Food was good.
Recommend this restaurant to anyone. Be sure and make a reservation!

title: beautiful
text:
Actually saw turtles swimming near the water.
A "must see" in Kauai. It has changed some since we were there 10 years ago, put up a nice fence and a nice cement viewing area. Really nice.

title: great tourist restaurant
text:
Been here for-ever. Food good, but pricey. Everyone knows where it is, lots of signs, etc.
Great owners, very "civic" oriented.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This hotel is great! Could have stayed many more days. Besides the beautiful surroundings the convenience is great. Staff was really helpful to someone who had never been to Seattle. Arranged a tour for us that was very enjoyable.

title: Great food in a small space
text:
When we saw the size of the building and all the cars in the parking lot, we almost kept going! So glad we didn't. Food and staff were wonderful.
We didn't have reservation (Sunday nite in May) but that was no problem for the friendly staff! We had a delightful meal and would definitely go back.

title: old and tired
text: This hotel seems very old and tired. Definitely needs a "face-lift". Very poor lighting. I was there for a sporting event for 4 nights. Seems every night something was wrong. They did give us a great rate. Very poor lighting. I will not return. Breakfast was good and hot. Evening reception as also very good. Good value for rate.

title: Great Fish
text: Good atmosphere. Nice hostess and server. Prices were in line with other nice restaurants in Myrtle Beach. Our first time to this location. Also dined in Destin, FL. Good there also.

title: Great Ride
text:
Good view, so glad we did this! Very professional, clean and air-conditioned. Staff is friendly and rest rooms were a big plus.
Highly recommend.

title: Excellent Property
text:
Beautiful property! I can't say enough nice things about this resort. The staff seems to go out of their way to make you feel welcome.
My husband and I had a deluxe 1-bedroom. Balcony over the small lake and the view was really nice. Screened, so insects were not a problem. Gated access that gave a very secure feeling. There was much to do, if you are interested. Lots for children. We didn't take advantage of any of the resort activities. Just really enjoyed the M.B. area and the lovely resort.
RCI timeshare exchange. We have had a time share for 31 years. One of the best we've ever exchanged. They should all be this nice.

title: great food
text:
We ate here two times during out stay in Falmouth. Always had seafood and it was super.
Definitely recommend!!

title: nice, clean, excellent staff
text:
Stayed here two nights in May. It looked very new. Really clean, great suite, and good price. Would stay here again. Nice location for the parks.
Great breakfast

title: great property to stay while exploring the North Rim
text:
Stayed here one night in May. Nice, clean and excellent staff. Room was HUGH! I guess it was a suite. Had a great tub with jets and very relaxing. Even had lights that you could read. So many hotels don't.
It was full, I saw several people turned away, we were glad we made reservations early.
WiFi was great and will definitely stay again.
place: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Kanab

title: Greatest Mexican Food....ever
text: Texans always think their Mexican Food is the best....but, try this, it is wonderful! Small, local folks and very friendly. Wish we could go back tomorrow!

title: Awesome property
text:
When you walk in the door, you are pleasantly surprised. Decor and atmosphere is wonderful!
My husband and I stayed here one night after a vacation to Southern Utah. We were very tired and this hotel is perfect. The roof top bar is really great too.
Thanks TA for all the reviews. I wouldn't have chosen this hotel if there wern't so many great reveiws. I can't wait to return!!
Only negative: dogs running everywhere.......they may be "precious", but to those who are alergetic they are NOT. My daughter couldn't ever stay here. (I think they belonged to staff)

title: Very nice, clean hotel with great staff
text:
We would stay here again. The staff is excellent. They really work at trying to help you find your way around Amsterdam. My husband and I thought is was a very difficult city to find your way around. There are no sidewalks and streets are full of taxis and bikes that I think try to run over you !
The hotel breakfast is wonderful, gets you started on a great day. We had a great room that over-looked the street. It was very quiet and sleeping wasn't difficult.
We booked several excrusions through the hotel and all were good.
place: Radisson Blu Hotel, Amsterdam City Center

title: Fabulous resort
text:
Nothing is more perfect than Disney! We hadn't stayed with Disney since our children were small. Now that we are retired we returned. Kinda concerned that it would be "noisy" and lots of kids screaming, not the situation. Resort is large and we had a great unit on the end, so quite I thought we were the only ones at the resort. Covered parking made it perfect. Mid week cleaning; beach house and a great staff are all included. Our unit was a two bed, two bath, more than enough for a couple.
The area is full of things to do and see. Great restaurants two many to name.

title: Great Staff
text:
Hotel has a great location. This is our second stay over the Thanksgiving Holiday. And we will return. It's right on the river and down further from all the noise of the restaurants.
When we checked in we had a room with a WALL view. Chris quickly gave us a wonderful river view/balcony room...WOW, it was great. We spent 4 nights and all the staff is great.
Only negative: Bath amenities are poor. No lotion. Only shampoo and terrible soap. After last year, I brought my own.
The breakfast and happy hour in the evening is wonderful.
place: Drury Inn & Suites San Antonio Riverwalk

title: Beautiful Property, great location
text:
My husband and I stayed here in Feb. during one of their promotions. The property, grounds and location are wonderful! The location is excellent for walking around Santa Fe. Parking is a premium, so the location worked well. I can't say enough about the staff. They all seemed to go out of their way to make you feel welcome.
The rooms are nicely furnished and very, very clean. Small, but don't spend alot of time there.
Negative: The heater was very loud, I think we were awaken every time it came on.
We will return.

title: beautiful embassy quality
text:
We stay at embassy whenever we can. Love the large CLEAN rooms. Everything always looks new.
We were disappointed in the "Mgr.s reception" Usually they have lots of great food. This time only pretzels and lots of candy, cookies. YUK There was some fruit, not what I would expect from an Embassy.
The morning breakfast was fabulous. Their usual, lots of everything; and GOOD.

title: fabulous resort
text:
This resort is absolutely lovely. The staff is fabulous. From the maid service to bar to all meals it was GREAT.
Only complaint: We paid more for an upgrade to "ocean view". What we got was a street view with a bar on the side. You had to really "search" for the ocean. The bar at night was loud and lots of grease smells. You really could not stay on the patio.
If you do upgrade, make sure where the room is located. We had the same room that those in our party who did not upgrade.
place: Hilton Playa del Carmen, an All-Inclusive Adult Only Resort

title: Great Staff, small room
text:
We stayed here 5 nights Thanksgiving week. The hotel is on the river. The river and river walk is fabulous!
We paid more for a "river view". It was nice, lots of trees, but we could see the river. The staff is exceptional. Very friendly and really do help you see all the SA sights. They always have time for their customers.
The room is not small it is VERY small. I'm glad we only brought one suitcase. A second wouldn't fit in the room! We were not in the room much, so it was OK. I thought for the price, it should have been larger. Why they put a hugh reclining chair in the room, I will never understand.
The breakfast is really nice and lots of it. You can always find something you like. Only bad thing is the TV is really loud and CNN news. Who wants that?? I noticed everyone sat as far away from the TV as possible.
I couldn't say anything good about the evening reception. Drinks are very small and "watered down". Very friendly hostess. Food was not good.
We loved our trip to SA and would definitely go back.

Took the trolley tour and it was great.
place: Drury Inn & Suites San Antonio Riverwalk

title: OK hotel
text:
Typical casino hotel, very small room. Only perks was a coffee pot. No refrigerator, microwave. Bath room looked old and VERY small, but there were 2 sinks, one was in the bathroom entry and made it very convenient. Shower was terrible, the water pressure was almost not there, but the towels were great and lots of them.
Best part of the hotel: Roxy's bar and restaurant. We ate 5 meals there and went to the martini bar 7 nights! Best in town. Fabulous hostess there named "Marla" (I think) She is definitely an asset to the restaurant. All the staff were great in the hotel.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
We were so glad we chose this hotel. It was alot more expensive, but the convenience to the airport was wonderful. When we arrived in Frankfurt it was raining and to just walk across the street to the hotel was so very nice.
If you have never been in the Frankfurt Airport it is very confusing! The hotel is not easy to find from the baggage pick-up, but it is wonderful once we found it.
We walked to the airport to have dinner, the hotel restaurant didn't seem to great. The only restaurant in that part of the airport was very good and we really enjoyed watching all the airplanes.
We difinitely recommend this hotel. Staff is really friendly and seem to go out of their way to make your visit good.
place: Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel & Conference Center

title: very expensive, not that great
text:
Stayed here 5 nights for a golf tournment. Shared with 2 other women.
The space was very adequate. Staff was very friendly, breakfast was very good. Every thing in the suite was working and beds were nice.
The BAD: 3-women need the bath and kitchen cleaned every day. The only housekeeping we received: towels picked up, beds made, trash emptied. 3-women need showers and toilets cleaned!!. When we complained they showed us a letter saying that's all we were going to have. 5 nights no cleaning!!
YUK
The evening "reception" was only on Tues., Wed, Thurs. I suppose these are the "slow" nights.
I guess they have never been to a Hilton. I think this is part of the Holiday Inn group.

title: Great hotel for the price.
text:
My husband and I stayed here two nights before leaving on a cruise. I certainly had my doubts after reading several reviews.

We really enjoyed this hotel. It was all-inclusive and we never had to worry about leaving for meals. The food in the buffet was really not to our tastes, but the speciality restaurant was fabulous. I can't say enough about the service.
Also we had lunch by the pool and it was great also. The breakfast buffet was good also. If going, I would eat only breakfast at the buffet. Lots and lots of Mexican dishes that I couldn't identify.
The front desk was very unfriendly. I think perhaps they did not speak English and didn't understand most we were saying.
Our room was small, but very clean and adequate for 2-nites.
The view from the balcony was wonderful!
Problem: Shower water went rapidly from HOT to cold. (whenever someone flushed)

There were no time share offers. No one even approached us.

I would return. Several couples on our ship told us how much the food was at their 4 & 5 star hotels, we decided that we certainly made the correct choice.
